title.narrative: Strengthening the GFMD Civil Society Network on Migration and Development

description.narrative: months to strengthen the representativeness and effectiveness of the network of civil society organizations as partners, among themselves and with governments, in framing and following-up on practical recommendations of the Global Forum on Migration and Development (GFMD), in particular by filling current global gaps in network engagement within and across civil society organizations in Africa, Asia and Latin America/the Caribbean.

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Directorate-General for International Partnerships (INTPA)
European Commission - Directorate-General for International Partnerships (INTPA)

description.narrative: 1) regional/cross regional levels:in Africa: Ghana, Kenya, Senegal and South Africa; in Asia: Bangladesh, India and the Philippines; in Latin America and the Caribbean: Argentina, Brazil, Mexico and the Dominican Republic.2) at global levels: through connecting to global GFMD meetings and fora, including in Sweden in 2014, Turkey in 2015, and a still-to-be-determined country in 2016.

title.narrative: Number of Civil Society Organisations participating in civil society activities of the Global Forum on Migration and Development

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.
